Presenting Problem / Chief Complaint: The patient expresses a desire to improve social skills, particularly in starting conversations with new people.
History of Present Illness (HPI): The patient reports feeling good about expressing themselves creatively and has improved their sleep through mindfulness practices.
Psychosocial History: The patient has engaged in open conversations with their daughters, which strengthened their relationship.
Physiological Observations: The patient reports a significant improvement in sleep quality, now sleeping well 75% of the time.
Current Functional Status: The patient has been enjoying a painting class and making new connections, indicating positive engagement in activities.
Progress Evaluation: The patient acknowledges making progress in their emotional well-being and social interactions.
Therapeutic Interventions: The patient is encouraged to practice conversational skills and set goals for social interactions.
Next Steps: The patient plans to try starting a conversation with someone new this week.
